name: Falsehoods Programmers Believe
description: A brief list of common falsehoods. A great overview and quick introduction into the world of falsehoods.

name: Falsehoods about Programming
description: A humbling and fun list on programming and programmers themselves.

name: Falsehoods about Falsehoods Lists
description: Meta commentary on how these falsehoods shouldn't be handled.

name: Falsehoods about Music
description: False assumption that might be made in codifying music.

name: Falsehoods about Art
description: Common misconceptions about art.

name: Falsehoods about Online Shopping
description: Covers prices, currencies and inventory.

name: Falsehoods about Prices
description: Covers currencies, amounts and localization.

name: Falsehoods about IBANs
description: International Bank Account Numbers are not international.

name: Falsehoods about Economics
description: Economics are not simple or rational.

name: Falsehoods about Cars
description: Even something as common as defining a car is full of pitfalls.

name: Falsehoods about Airline Seat Maps
description: Airline seat maps are far more complex than just neat rows and columns of seats.

name: Decimal Point Error in Etsy's Accounting System
description: The importance of types in accounting software: missing the decimal point ends up with 100x over-charges.

name: Characters < and > in company names lead to XSS attacks
description: Because UK allows companies to be registered with special characters, a hacker leveraged them to register \"><SCRIPT SRC=MJT.XSS.HT></SCRIPT> LTD, but also ; DROP TABLE "COMPANIES";-- LTD, BETTS & TWINE LTD and SAFDASD & SFSAF \' SFDAASF\" LTD.

name: CLDR currency definitions
description: Currency validity date ranges overlap due to revolts, invasions, new constitutions, and slow planned adoption.

name: tax
description: A PHP 5.4+ tax management library.

name: Falsehoods about Time
description: Seminal article on dates and time.

name: More Falsehoods about Time
description: Part. 2 of the article above.

name: Falsehoods about Time and Time Zones
description: Another takes on time-related falsehoods, with an emphasis on time zones.

name: Critique of Falsehoods about Time
description: Takes on the first article above and provides an explanation of each falsehood, with more context and external resources.

name: Falsehoods about Unix Time
description: Mind the leap second!

name: Falsehoods about Time Zones
description: Has some nice points regarding the edge-cases of DST transitions.

name: Your Calendrical Fallacy Is Thinking…
description: List covering intercalation and cultural influence, made by a community of iOS and macOS developers.

name: Time Zone Database
description: Code and data that represent the history of local time for many representative locations around the globe.

name: The Long, Painful History of Time
description: Most of the idiosyncrasies in timekeeping can find an explanation in history.

name: You Advocate a Calendar Reform
description: Your idea will not work. This article tells you why.

name: So You Want to Abolish Time Zones
description: Abolishing timezones may sound like a good idea, but there are quite a few complications that make it not quite so.

name: The Problem with Time & Timezones
description: A video about why you should never, ever deal with timezones if you can help it.

name: $26,000 Overcollection by Labor Department
description: The consequence of wrong calendar accounting.

name: RFC-3339 vs ISO-8601
description: An giant list of formats from the two standards, how they overlaps, and live examples.

name: ISO-8601, YYYY, yyyy, and why your year may be wrong
description: String formatting of date is hard.

name: UTC is Enough for everyone, right?
description: There are edge cases about dates and time (specifically UTC) that you probably haven't thought of.

name: Storing UTC is not a silver bullet
description: "Just store dates in UTC" is not always the right approach.

name: How to choose between UT1, TAI and UTC
description: Depends on your priorities between SI seconds, earth rotation sync, leap seconds avoidance.

name: Why is subtracting these two times (in 1927) giving a strange result?
description: Infamous Stack Overflow answer about both complicated historical timezones, and how historical dates can be re-interpreted by newer versions of software.

name: Critical and Significant Dates
description: From Y2K to the overflow of 32-bit seconds from Unix epoch, a list of special date to watch for depending on the system.

name: Falsehoods CS Students (Still) Believe Upon Graduating
description: A list of things (not only) computer science students tend to erroneously and at times surprisingly believe even though they (probably) should know better.

name: Postdoc myths
description: Lots of things are said, written and believed about postdoctoral researchers that are simply not true..

name: I Knew How to Validate an Email Address Until I Read the RFC
description: Provides intricate examples that are unsuspected valid email addresses according the RFC-822.

name: So you think you can validate email addresses (FOSDEM 2018)
description: Presentation of edge-case email addresses and why you should not use regex to parse them.

name: Your E-Mail Validation Logic is Wrong
description: A summary of the various, surprising things that are allowed in an email address.

name: Falsehoods about Geography
description: Takes on places, their names and locations.

name: Falsehoods about Maps
description: Covers coordinates, projection and GIS.

name: I Hate Coordinate Systems
description: A guide for geospatial practitioners on diagnosing and fixing common issues with coordinate systems.

name: Top 5 most insane kanji place names in Japan
description: “There's one special group of kanji that's hard even for Japanese people to read: place names.”

name: Falsehoods about Names
description: The article that started it all.

name: Falsehoods about Names – With Examples
description: A revisited version of the article above, this time with detailed explanations.

name: Falsehoods about Biometrics
description: Fingerprints are not unique.

name: Falsehoods about Families
description: You can't really define a family with strict rules.

name: Falsehoods about Gender: #1 & #2
description: Gender is part of human identity and has its own subtleties.

name: Falsehoods about Me
description: Issues at the intersection of names and gender and internationalization.

name: Gay Marriage: The Database Engineering Perspective
description: How to store a marriage in a database while addressing most of the falsehoods about gender, naming and relationships.

name: Personal Names Around the World
description: How do people's names differ around the world, and what are the implications for the Web?

name: XKCD #327: Exploits of a Mom
description: Funny take on how implementation of a falsehood might lead to security holes.

name: Hello, I'm Mr. Null. My Name Makes Me Invisible to Computers
description: Real-life example on how implemented falsehood has negative impact on someone's life.

name: My name causes an issue with any booking!
description: Old airline reservation systems considers the MR suffix as Mister and drops it.

name: HL7 v3 RIM
description: A flexible data model for representing human names.

name: Apple iOS NSPersonNameComponentsFormatter
description: Localized representations of the components of a person's name.

name: Falsehoods about Language
description: Translating a software from English is not as straightforward as it seems to be.

name: Falsehoods about Plain Text
description: Plain text can't cut it and why it's surprising Unicode works as well as it does.

name: Internationalis(z)ing Code
description: A video about things you need to keep in mind when internationalizing your code.

name: Minimum to Know About Unicode and Character Sets
description: A good introduction to unicode, its historical context and origins, followed by an overview of its inner working.

name: Awesome Unicode
description: A curated list of delightful Unicode tidbits, packages and resources.

name: Dark corners of Unicode
description: Unicode is extensive, here be dragons.

name: Let's Stop Ascribing Meaning to Code Points
description: Dives deeper in Unicode and dispels myths about code points.

name: Breaking Our Latin-1 Assumptions
description: Most programmers spend so much time with Latin-1 they forgets about other's scripts quirks.

name: Ode to a shipping label
description: Character encoding is hard, more so when each broken layer of data input adds its own spice.

name: i18n Testing Data
description: Compilation of real-word international and diverse name data for unit testing and QA.

name: Big List of Naughty Strings
description: A huge corpus of strings which have a high probability of causing issues when used as user-input data. A must have set of practical edge-cases to test your software against.

name: Falsehoods about Job Applicants
description: Assumptions about job applicants and their job histories aren't necessarily true.

name: Falsehoods about Video
description: Cover it all: video decoding and playback, files, image scaling, color spaces and conversion, displays and subtitles.

name: Horrible edge cases to consider when dealing with music
description: Music catalogs data are full of crazy stuff.

name: MusicBrainz database schema
description: An open-source project and database that seems to have solved the complexity of music catalog management.

name: DDEX
description: The industry standard for music metadata, including archiving, sound recording, sales and usage reporting, royalties and license deals.

name: Apple Music Style Guide
description: Quality insurance guidelines to format music, art, and metadata to increase discoverability.

name: Falsehoods about Networks
description: Covers TCP, DHCP, DNS, VLANs and IPv4/v6.

name: Fallacies of Distributed Computing
description: Assumptions that programmers new to distributed applications invariably make.

name: There's more than one way to write an IP address
description: Some parts of the address are optional, mind the decimal and octal notations, and don't forget IPv6 either.

name: URLs: It's complicated…
description: There's a lot of components in an URL, and all have their own logic.

name: hostname-validate
description: An attempt to validate hostnames in Python.

name: Falsehoods about Phone Numbers
description: Covers phone numbers, their representation and meaning.

name: libphonenumber
description: Google's common Java, C++ and JavaScript library for parsing, formatting, and validating international phone numbers. Also available for C#, Objective-C, Python, Ruby and PHP.

name: Falsehoods about Addresses
description: Covers streets, postal codes, buildings, cities and countries.

name: Falsehoods about Residence
description: It's not only about the address itself, but the relationship between a person and its residence.

name: Letter Delivered Despite No Name, No Address
description: Ultimate falsehood about postal addresses: you do not need one.

name: The Bear with Its Own ZIP Code
description: Smokey Bear has his own ZIP Code (20252) because he gets so much mail.

name: Regex and Postal Addresses
description: Why regular expressions and street addresses do not mix.

name: Parsing the Infamous Japanese Postal CSV
description: “I saw many horrors, but I've never seen this particular formatting choice anywhere else.”

name: libaddressinput
description: Google's common C++ and Java library for parsing, formatting, and validating international postal addresses.

name: addressing
description: A PHP 5.4+ addressing library, powered by Google's dataset.

name: postal-address
description: Python module to parse, normalize and render postal addresses.

name: address
description: Go library to validate and format addresses using Google's dataset.

name: Falsehoods about Systems of Measurement
description: On working with systems of measurement and converting between them.

name: Falsehoods about Political Appointments
description: Designing election systems has its own tricks.

name: Falsehoods about Women In Tech
description: Myth about women in STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Math) industries.

name: Falsehoods about Versions
description: Attributing an identity to a software release might be harder than thought.

name: Falsehoods about Build Systems
description: Building software is hard. Building software that builds software is harder.

name: Falsehoods about REST APIs
description: Pitfalls to be mindful of when creating and documenting APIs.

name: Falsehoods about CSVs
description: While RFC4180 to exists, it is far from definitive and goes largely ignored.

name: Falsehoods about Package Managers
description: Covers package and their managers.

name: Falsehoods about Testing
description: An attempt to establish a list of falsehoods about testing.

name: Falsehoods about Search
description: Why search (including analysis, tokenization, highlighting) is deceptively complex.

name: What every software engineer should know about search
description: A better sourced article on the difficulty of implementing search engines.

name: Falsehoods about Bitcoin
description: A list of mistaken perspectives on Bitcoin.

name: Falsehoods about Pagination
description: Why your pagination algorithm is giving someone (possibly you) a headache.

name: Falsehoods about garbage collection
description: Misconceptions about the predictability and performance of garbage collection.

name: Myths about File Paths
description: Diversity of file-systems and OSes makes file paths a little harder than we might think of.

name: Myths about CPU Caches
description: Misconceptions about caches often lead to false assertions, especially when it comes to concurrency and race conditions.

name: Myths about /dev/urandom
description: There are a few things about /dev/urandom and /dev/random that are repeated again and again. Still they are false.

name: Hi! My name is…
description: This talk could have been named "falsehoods about usernames (and other identifiers)".

name: Popular misconceptions about mtime
description: Part of a post on why file's mtime comparison could be considered harmful.

name: Rules for Autocomplete
description: Not falsehoods per se, but still a great list of good practices to implement autocompletion.

name: Floating Point Math
description: "Your language isn't broken, it's doing floating point math. (…) This is why, more often than not, 0.1 + 0.2 != 0.3."

name: The Hidden Complexity of Downloading Favicons, Told in 15+ Edge Cases
description: Downloading that little icon you see in you browser tabs should be a simple exercise. It turned out to be a lot more complicated than you think. Be vigilant that you are not shaving a Yak.

name: Norway is not False
description: Norway's ISO country code is also valid YAML for False.

name: Falsehoods about Fonts
description: Assumptions about typography on the web and in desktop applications.

name: Truths programmers should know about case
description: A complete reverse of the falsehoods format, on the topic of case (as in uppercase and lowercase text).

name: The Door Problem
description: All the things you have not considered implementing for your doors in games.
